question.text: In a given DNA segment, ATG ACC AGG ACC CCA ACA, the first base gets mutated. The effect of this on coding by this DNA segment will result in

options.text: Complete change in the type as well as sequence of amino acid
Change in the first amino acid only
One amino acid less in the protein

solution.text: For the given DNA segment, if the first base gets mutated, then there will be a change in the first amino acid only because each amino acid consists of a triplet code consisting of three nucleotides bases. When for a given DNA segment the first base gets mutated then only that particular part consisting of three bases and specific for a particular amino acid will change.
